sentences.en: "All right, I can manage a fiver," McMinn said with reluctance.
sentences.cn: 麦克明不情愿地说：“好吧，我可以出5镑。”

sentences.en: But she shrank with peculiar reluctance from any risk of estranging it.
sentences.cn: 但她一向小心翼翼,唯恐失掉它.

sentences.en: Haley, with visible reluctance, handed over the fifty dollars to Tom.
sentences.cn: 海利很不乐意地交给汤姆五十块钱.

sentences.en: He showed great reluctance to accept the responsibility thrust upon him.
sentences.cn: 对强加给他的责任,他不乐于承担.

sentences.en: He showed the greatest reluctance to make a reply.
Ministers have shown extreme reluctance to explain their position to the media.
sentences.cn: 部长们极不情愿向媒体解释他们的立场。

sentences.en: She made a great show of reluctance, but finally accepted our offer.
sentences.cn: 她对我们的建议做出极不满意的样子, 但最后还是接受了.

sentences.en: The animal is usually presented with a history of reluctance to eat.
sentences.cn: 动物常有拒绝采食的病史.

sentences.en: The police released Andrew with reluctance.
sentences.cn: 警方勉强把安德鲁放走了.

sentences.en: The reluctance to go home was not confined to wayward men.
sentences.cn: 舍不得回家的并不限于任性的男客.

sentences.en: Then, with reluctance: " I want to get the grass cut, " he said.
sentences.cn: 然后, 他勉强地说: “ 我要让人把草地平整一下. ”

sentences.en: These political tensions explain the reluctance of financiers to invest in the region.
sentences.cn: 政局的紧张使金融家不愿意在该地区投资.
他们依依不舍地分手了.

sentences.en: We understand your reluctance to take this case.
sentences.cn: 我们理解你不愿意接受这个案子.

sentences.en: Wells finally agreed, but with reluctance.
sentences.cn: 韦尔斯最终同意了，但很勉强。

words.tran_cn: 不情愿的；勉强的；顽抗的

trans.tran_cn: 不情愿，勉强，[电]磁阻，反应式
trans.tran_en: when someone is unwilling to do something, or when they do something slowly to show that they are not very willing
